text: The 1897 County Championship was the eighth officially organised running of the County Championship, and ran from 3 May to 30 August 1897. Lancashire County Cricket Club won the championship for the first time, narrowly beating Surrey. ==Table== * One point was awarded for a win, and one point was taken away for each loss. Final placings were decided by dividing the number of points earned by the number of completed matches (i.e. those that ended in win or loss), and multiplexing by 100. {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- !width=175 |Team !width=20 abbr="Played" |Pld !width=20 abbr="Won" |W !width=20 abbr="Lost" |L !width=20 abbr="Drawn" |D !width=20 abbr="Points" |Pts !width=20 abbr="Finished matches" |Fin !width=50 abbr="Percentage of finished matches" |%Fin |- style="background:#ccffcc;" |style="text-align:left;"|Lancashire |26||16||3||7||13||19||68.42 |- |style="text-align:left;"|Surrey |26||17||4||5||13||21||61.90 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Essex |16||7||2||7||5||9||55.56 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Yorkshire |26||13||5||8||8||18||44.44 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Gloucestershire |18||7||5||6||2||12||16.67 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Sussex |20||5||6||9||–1||11||–9.09 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Middlesex |16||3||4||9||–1||7||–14.29 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Warwickshire |18||3||4||11||–1||7||–14.29 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Hampshire |18||4||7||7||–3||11||–27.27 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Nottinghamshire |16||2||5||9||–3||7||–42.86 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Somerset |16||3||9||4||–6||12||–50.00 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Kent |18||2||10||6||–8||12||–66.67 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Leicestershire |14||1||10||3||–9||11||–81.82 |- |style="text- align:left;"|Derbyshire |16||0||9||7||–9||9||–100.00 |- |colspan=10 align="left"|Source: CricketArchive |} ==Leading averages== {| |- valign="top" || {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left;" !colspan=4| Most runs |- !
